prompt_text:
Write an urgent, inspiring GivingTuesday campaign email for [ORGANIZATION NAME]
to send on GivingTuesday morning (or day before). The email should:

- Lead with the GivingTuesday movement and why TODAY matters
- Connect GivingTuesday to your specific mission: [MISSION/CAUSE]
- Present a specific, achievable 24-hour fundraising goal: [GOAL AMOUNT/NUMBER OF DONORS]
- Explain what the goal will accomplish: [IMPACT OF GOAL]
- Include suggested donation amounts with specific impact: [AMOUNT OPTIONS]
- Create urgency (24-hour window, matching gift if applicable: [MATCH DETAILS])
- Make it social-media-friendly with easy share links/language
- Include multiple calls-to-action: donate, share, volunteer
- Add progress updates if sending throughout the day: [CURRENT PROGRESS]
- Be energetic and action-oriented without being overwhelming
- Be 200-300 words for email (keep it scannable)
- Use an [URGENT/EXCITED/HOPEFUL] tone
- Be signed by [SIGNER NAME and TITLE]
- Include P.S. with deadline reminder and easy donate link

The email should capture GivingTuesday's collective energy while focusing on your
organization's specific impact. Make donors feel part of a global movement AND
your local mission.

scenarios.name: Small Community Org
scenarios.description: Neighborhood youth arts nonprofit in East Oakland serving low-income families; primarily individual donors and local businesses.

values.MISSION/CAUSE: Free, high-quality after-school and weekend arts programs for Oakland teens, with safe transportation and mentorship.
values.IMPACT OF GOAL: Fund 100 full scholarships for our spring session, stock two studios with supplies for six months, and provide AC Transit passes so students can get to class safely.
values.AMOUNT OPTIONS:
- $25 supplies a sketchbook + pencils for one student
- $50 covers a week of bus fare for a teen to attend class
- $100 equips a student with studio supplies for a month
- $250 brings a visiting artist for a workshop
- $500 provides a full semester scholarship for one teen
values.MATCH DETAILS: All gifts doubled today up to $7,500 thanks to Red Bay Coffee and two local families (through 6 p.m. PT).
values.CURRENT PROGRESS: 10:00 a.m. PT update: 68 donors, $6,420 raised (26% to goal).

scenarios.name: Mid-Size Regional Org
scenarios.description: Statewide nonprofit delivering mobile dental and vision clinics across rural Kansas; donor base includes individuals, clinics, and regional businesses.

values.MISSION/CAUSE: Bringing free and low-cost mobile dental and vision care to uninsured and underinsured residents in rural Kansas.
values.IMPACT OF GOAL: Deploy 12 mobile clinic days across 6 counties in January–February, providing exams, cleanings, fillings, and glasses to 600 patients.
values.AMOUNT OPTIONS:
- $35 purchases a dental exam kit for one patient
- $75 provides prescription glasses for an adult or child
- $150 fuels a mobile clinic for one day in a rural county
- $500 stocks dental supplies for a full clinic day
- $1,000 sponsors an entire clinic day in a high-need town
values.MATCH DETAILS: Pioneer Prairie Bank will match the first $25,000 in gifts dollar-for-dollar today.
values.CURRENT PROGRESS: 1:00 p.m. CT update: $20,650 raised from 214 donors (41% of goal).

scenarios.name: Large Established Org
scenarios.description: Established New York City nonprofit focused on homelessness prevention and rapid rehousing; diverse donor base with major corporate partners.

values.MISSION/CAUSE: Prevent homelessness and move families from shelters into safe, stable housing with rental assistance, case management, and employment support.
values.IMPACT OF GOAL: Open 200 emergency winter beds immediately and fund 120 rapid-rehousing placements by January 31, including move-in support and 3 months of stabilization services.
values.AMOUNT OPTIONS:
- $50 provides hot meals and winter supplies for a family for two days
- $150 covers a month of transit passes for job searches and appointments
- $500 funds a move-in kit (linens, cookware, cleaning supplies) for one family
- $1,000 bridges part of first-month rent so a family can sign a lease
- $5,000 supports a landlord partnership and intensive case management for one placement
values.MATCH DETAILS: The Morgan & Finch Foundation will match every gift dollar-for-dollar up to $300,000 today.
values.CURRENT PROGRESS: 4:00 p.m. ET update: 1,420 donors and $338,500 raised (56% to goal).

outputs.content:
Subject: 🔥 TODAY IS THE DAY! Let's Ignite Creativity for East Oakland Teens this GivingTuesday! 🔥

Dear East Oakland Youth Arts Collective Community,

It's here! **GivingTuesday 2023 is LIVE**, and all over the world, people are coming together to unleash an incredible wave of generosity. While the world unites, TODAY, we have an urgent and exciting mission right here in East Oakland: to empower our incredible teens through the transformative power of art!

At East Oakland Youth Arts Collective, we provide FREE, high-quality after-school and weekend arts programs, complete with safe transportation and mentorship, because we believe every young person deserves a vibrant space to discover their voice.

**TODAY, in just 24 HOURS, we need your help to raise $25,000 from 300 passionate donors!**

**Why this goal?** Reaching it will mean:
*   Funding **100 full scholarships** for our spring session
*   Stocking **two studios** with essential supplies for six months
*   Providing crucial **AC Transit passes** so students can get to class safely, every time.

**Here's the BEST part: Every single gift made TODAY is DOUBLED!** That's right! Thanks to the incredible generosity of Red Bay Coffee and two local families, **all gifts up to $7,500 will be matched through 6 p.m. PT!** Your impact just got TWICE as powerful!

Every dollar makes a difference for an East Oakland teen:
*   **$25** supplies a sketchbook + pencils for one student
*   **$50** covers a week of bus fare for a teen to attend class
*   **$100** equips a student with studio supplies for a month
*   **$250** brings a visiting artist for an inspiring workshop
*   **$500** provides a full semester scholarship for one teen!

**[DONATE NOW & DOUBLE YOUR IMPACT!]**

**10:00 a.m. PT update: WOW! We're off to an amazing start! 68 donors have already raised $6,420 (26% to goal)! Let's keep this momentum going!**

This isn't just a donation; it's an investment in creativity, confidence, and community. Let's make this GivingTuesday unforgettable for our youth!

**Please Donate, Share, and Spread the Word!**
*   **[Click to Donate!]**
*   **[Share on Facebook]** | **[Share on Twitter]** | **[Share on Instagram]**
*   Want to go even further? **[Learn about volunteering!]**

Thank you for being a champion for East Oakland's young artists!

With immense gratitude and excitement,

Marisol Vega
Executive Director
East Oakland Youth Arts Collective

P.S. Don't forget, our special matching gift ends at 6 p.m. PT, and the entire campaign closes at midnight tonight! Let's reach our goal and empower hundreds of teens! **[MAKE YOUR GIFT COUNT NOW!]**

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, energetic GivingTuesday email that hits all major requirements and captures the excitement of the day. It effectively balances the global movement with local impact. However, it exceeds the word count significantly (430+ words vs. 200-300 requested), which reduces scannability and may hurt email performance. Minor issues include the dated '2023' reference and slightly over-the-top formatting.
strengths: Excellent tone matching - genuinely excited and energetic without being pushy or overwhelming
Complete coverage of all prompt requirements including matching gift, progress update, multiple CTAs, and social sharing
Strong impact ladder with specific, tangible donation amounts that connect directly to mission
Effective use of formatting (bold, bullets, emojis) to create visual hierarchy and energy
Compelling P.S. that reinforces both urgency elements (match deadline AND midnight deadline)
Good balance between GivingTuesday global movement framing and hyper-local Oakland mission
Multiple clear calls-to-action for donate, share, and volunteer as requested
weaknesses: Significantly exceeds word count (430+ words vs. 200-300 requested), which hurts scannability and mobile readability - a critical issue for email performance
Includes '2023' which will date the template and require editing - should be year-agnostic or use current year variable
Slightly excessive use of emphasis (bold, caps, exclamation points, emojis) - while energetic, borders on overwhelming in places
The 10 a.m. progress update placement interrupts flow mid-email rather than appearing as a natural update section
Could be more concise in the opening paragraphs to get to the ask faster

outputs.content:
**Subject: DOUBLE YOUR IMPACT for Oakland teens—TODAY ONLY! 🎨**

**[Alternative subject: It's GivingTuesday! Help us unlock $7,500 for East Oakland artists]**

---

Today, millions of people worldwide are opening their hearts for #GivingTuesday—and East Oakland teens are counting on YOU to be part of this movement!

**Our ambitious 24-hour goal: $25,000 from 300 donors by midnight tonight.**

This will fund **100 full scholarships** for our spring session, stock two studios with supplies for six months, and provide AC Transit passes so students can get to class safely.

**EVEN BETTER NEWS:** Red Bay Coffee and two local families are **DOUBLING every gift** up to $7,500—but only until 6 p.m. PT today!

**Your impact RIGHT NOW:**
- **$25** → supplies a sketchbook + pencils for one student
- **$50** → covers a week of safe bus fare to class
- **$100** → equips a student with studio supplies for a month
- **$250** → brings a visiting artist for a workshop
- **$500** → provides a full semester scholarship

**[DONATE NOW: www.eoycollective.org/givingtuesday]**

Every teen deserves a safe space to create, mentors who believe in them, and transportation to get there. Today, you make that possible.

**Can't give? SHARE THIS EMAIL** or post: "I'm supporting @EastOaklandYAC this #GivingTuesday! Free arts programs + safe transportation for Oakland teens. Double your impact by 6pm: [LINK]"

Let's show our young artists what community looks like!

With gratitude,

**Marisol Vega**  
Executive Director  
East Oakland Youth Arts Collective

**P.S.** Midnight deadline! Your gift DOUBLES until 6 p.m.—don't wait: **[LINK]**

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professional GivingTuesday email that effectively balances urgency with excitement. It hits all major requirements, uses clear formatting for scannability, and provides actionable next steps. The tone is appropriately energetic without being overwhelming, and the specific impact statements are compelling and authentic to the organization's mission.
strengths: Excellent subject line options that create urgency and include emojis appropriate for the excited tone
Clear, scannable formatting with bold text highlighting key information and donation amounts
Strong specificity in impact statements that connect donations directly to tangible outcomes (sketchbooks, bus fare, scholarships)
Effective use of the matching gift as both urgency driver and value multiplier with clear deadline (6 p.m. PT)
Includes multiple CTAs as requested: donate buttons, social sharing language with ready-to-use copy and hashtags
Word count appropriate at approximately 250 words, making it digestible for email
P.S. effectively reinforces both the deadline and matching opportunity
Authentic voice that feels community-focused rather than corporate
weaknesses: Missing the requested 'CURRENT PROGRESS' update (10 a.m. PT: 68 donors, $6,420 raised) which would add social proof and momentum
Volunteer CTA mentioned in requirements but not included in the email—only donate and share options provided
Could strengthen the 'global movement AND local mission' connection slightly more explicitly in opening paragraph
The alternative subject line is quite long and may get cut off in many email clients

outputs.content:
Subject: It’s GivingTuesday—double your impact for Oakland teens today!

Today, the world shows up for generosity. On GivingTuesday, your gift powers free, high-quality after-school and weekend arts programs for Oakland teens—with safe transportation and mentorship that keep students creating and thriving.

Our 24-hour goal: $25,000 from 300 donors. What your support will do this spring:
- Fund 100 full scholarships
- Stock two studios with supplies for six months
- Provide AC Transit passes so students can get to class safely

Give now and your gift is doubled up to $7,500 thanks to Red Bay Coffee and two local families (through 6 p.m. PT).

Choose your impact:
- $25 = sketchbook + pencils for one student
- $50 = a week of bus fare for a teen
- $100 = a month of studio supplies
- $250 = a visiting artist workshop
- $500 = a full semester scholarship for one teen

Act now:
- Donate: eoyac.org/give
- Share: “I’m supporting East Oakland Youth Arts Collective for #GivingTuesday—join me! eoyac.org/give”
- Volunteer: eoyac.org/volunteer

10:00 a.m. PT update: 68 donors, $6,420 raised (26% to goal).

Together, let’s open doors to creativity, community, and safe pathways to the studio—today.

With gratitude and urgency,
Marisol Vega
Executive Director, East Oakland Youth Arts Collective

P.S. All gifts doubled until 6 p.m. PT—help us reach 300 donors and $25,000 by midnight. Give now: eoyac.org/give

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professional GivingTuesday email that hits all required elements with appropriate urgency and energy. It's scannable, action-oriented, and would likely be effective. Minor weaknesses include slightly generic phrasing in places and the closing line feeling somewhat overwrought.
strengths: Excellent structure and scannability with clear bullet points, donation tiers, and multiple CTAs
Strong subject line that immediately communicates the matching gift opportunity
Specific, concrete impact statements that connect donations to real outcomes for Oakland teens
Effective use of progress update to create momentum and social proof
Good balance of urgency without being overwhelming—multiple deadlines (6pm match, midnight goal) create layered urgency
Social share language is ready-to-use and includes hashtag
Word count (approximately 230 words) fits the 200-300 word requirement perfectly
P.S. effectively reinforces key deadlines and CTA
weaknesses: Opening line 'Today, the world shows up for generosity' feels slightly generic/clichéd rather than authentically excited
The closing 'open doors to creativity, community, and safe pathways to the studio' is a bit wordy and abstract compared to the concrete impact statements earlier
Could strengthen the connection between GivingTuesday as a global movement and this local mission—the transition feels abrupt
Minor: The progress update placement mid-email might work better near the top or in a highlighted callout box for visual emphasis

outputs.content:
**Subject: URGENT: 24 Hours to Bring Health & Hope to Rural Kansas This GivingTuesday!**

Friend,

Today is **GivingTuesday**, a global day of radical generosity. But for Sunflower Community Health Alliance, today is more than a movement – it's our chance to profoundly impact the health of our rural Kansas neighbors.

Right now, countless uninsured and underinsured residents in our communities lack access to basic dental and vision care. They face pain, lost productivity, and declining quality of life. **But with your urgent help today, we can change that.**

**Our audacious GivingTuesday goal: Raise $50,000 or secure 500 donors by midnight CT TONIGHT!**

**Why today matters:** Reaching this goal means we can immediately **deploy 12 mobile clinic days across 6 counties in January and February**, providing critical exams, cleanings, fillings, and prescription glasses to **600 patients** who desperately need them.

**Your donation, no matter the size, fuels this mission:**

*   **$35** purchases a dental exam kit for one patient
*   **$75** provides prescription glasses for an adult or child
*   **$150** fuels a mobile clinic for one day in a rural county
*   **$500** stocks dental supplies for a full clinic day
*   **$1,000** sponsors an entire clinic day in a high-need town

**And here’s the game-changer: Pioneer Prairie Bank will match the first $25,000 in gifts dollar-for-dollar today! Your impact is DOUBLED!**

**This is a 24-hour window to make an unparalleled difference.**

**[Click here to double your impact and donate NOW!]**

**1:00 p.m. CT update: Amazing! We’ve already raised $20,650 from 214 donors! That's 41% of our goal! Let's keep this momentum going!**

Please, share this message widely! Use #GivingTuesday and tag us @SunflowerHealth – let’s make some noise!

Together, we can bring brighter smiles and clearer vision to rural Kansas.

With immense gratitude,

Dr. Lila Nguyen
Program Director
Sunflower Community Health Alliance

**P.S. Don't let this opportunity pass! The Pioneer Prairie Bank match and our $50,000 goal expire at midnight CT TONIGHT! Give now: [Link to Donation Page]**

evaluation.reasoning: This email successfully incorporates all required elements and creates genuine urgency appropriate for GivingTuesday. However, it exceeds the 200-300 word limit (approximately 340 words), uses somewhat hyperbolic language ('audacious,' 'radical generosity'), and could feel slightly overwhelming despite instructions to avoid that. The structure is strong and would likely be effective with minor refinements.
strengths: Excellent use of all prompt elements including progress update, matching gift, specific donation tiers, and multiple CTAs
Strong concrete impact statements that clearly connect donations to outcomes (600 patients, 12 clinic days, specific counties)
Effective urgency creation through countdown language, matching gift deadline, and progress tracker without being manipulative
Good scannable format with bold text, bullet points, and clear visual hierarchy
Appropriate P.S. with deadline reminder and donation link as requested
weaknesses: Exceeds the specified 200-300 word count by approximately 40 words, making it less scannable than intended
Language occasionally veers toward hyperbole ('audacious,' 'radical generosity,' 'unparalleled difference') which may reduce authenticity
The phrase 'desperately need them' could be seen as potentially patronizing to beneficiaries
Social media sharing instructions are present but could be more actionable with specific suggested post language
Opening 'Friend,' salutation feels slightly generic for a personalized campaign

outputs.content:
**Subject: [LIVE NOW] Pioneer Prairie Bank is MATCHING your gift—help us reach 600 Kansas families today! 🌻**

**Preheader:** Every dollar DOUBLED until noon. 12 mobile clinics. 6 counties. 600 neighbors. Let's do this together.

---

Today is **GivingTuesday**—a global movement of generosity happening RIGHT NOW in all 50 states and 80+ countries. And here in rural Kansas, we're turning that energy into **mobile dental chairs, eye exams, and hope.**

**Our 24-hour mission: Raise $50,000 or reach 500 donors by midnight CT** to deploy **12 mobile clinic days across 6 counties** this January and February—bringing free dental care and glasses to **600 uninsured neighbors** who would otherwise go without.

**🎉 URGENT: Pioneer Prairie Bank is matching the first $25,000 donated TODAY, dollar-for-dollar!** Your $75 gift becomes $150. Your impact DOUBLES.

### **Your gift today provides:**
- **$35** → Dental exam kit for one patient  
- **$75** → Prescription glasses for a child or adult  
- **$150** → Fuel for one mobile clinic day  
- **$500** → Dental supplies for a full clinic  
- **$1,000** → Sponsors an entire clinic in a high-need town  

**[GIVE NOW — YOUR GIFT IS DOUBLED →]**

Share this mission! Forward this email or post: *"I'm supporting @SunflowerHealth's mobile clinics bringing dental and vision care to rural Kansas families. Join me: [link] #GivingTuesday"*

**Every dollar. Every share. Every hour counts.**

With urgency and gratitude,

**Dr. Lila Nguyen**  
Program Director, Sunflower Community Health Alliance

**P.S.** Midnight CT deadline. Matching funds run out at $25,000. **[Double your impact now →]**

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, actionable GivingTuesday email that captures urgency and mission effectively. It hits most requirements and would be immediately usable by a nonprofit professional. However, it has notable omissions (volunteer CTA, progress update) and a confusing match deadline discrepancy that would need correction.
strengths: Excellent subject line and preheader that create urgency and clearly communicate the match opportunity
Strong opening that connects global GivingTuesday movement to local Kansas mission authentically
Clear, scannable formatting with effective use of bold, bullets, and emoji that works well for email
Specific impact language that makes donations tangible (600 patients, 12 clinic days, 6 counties)
Good donation ladder with concrete outcomes at each level
Effective social media share language included with specific copy and hashtag
Appropriate urgent tone without being guilt-driven or overwhelming
Strong P.S. with deadline reminder as requested
weaknesses: Missing volunteer call-to-action entirely—prompt requested multiple CTAs including donate, share, AND volunteer
Does not include the progress update provided in scenario (1:00 p.m. CT update showing $20,650 raised from 214 donors)
Confusing match deadline: preheader says 'until noon' but body and P.S. say match runs to $25,000 threshold—this creates uncertainty about when match expires
Word count appears slightly under 200 words for body content (excluding subject/preheader)
Could strengthen the 'global movement AND local mission' connection requested in prompt

outputs.content:
Subject: URGENT: It’s GivingTuesday—double your impact for smiles and sight in rural Kansas

Today, the world is giving. On GivingTuesday, your gift joins a global movement—and here at home it powers a very local mission: bringing free and low-cost mobile dental and vision care to uninsured and underinsured residents in rural Kansas. Only today, Pioneer Prairie Bank will match the first $25,000 dollar-for-dollar. Your gift before midnight CT goes twice as far.

Our 24-hour goal: raise $50,000 or engage 500 donors by midnight CT to deploy 12 mobile clinic days across 6 counties in January–February—delivering exams, cleanings, fillings, and glasses for 600 patients.

Give now and see your impact:
- $35 purchases a dental exam kit for one patient
- $75 provides prescription glasses for an adult or child
- $150 fuels a mobile clinic for one day in a rural county
- $500 stocks dental supplies for a full clinic day
- $1,000 sponsors an entire clinic day in a high-need town

Donate now (matched): give.sunfloweralliance.org/GT
Share the movement: “I gave to Sunflower Community Health Alliance for GivingTuesday to bring mobile dental and vision care to rural Kansas. Join me: give.sunfloweralliance.org/GT”
Quick share links: Facebook: sunfloweralliance.org/GTfb | X: sunfloweralliance.org/GTx | Instagram: sunfloweralliance.org/GTig
Volunteer on a clinic day: sunfloweralliance.org/volunteer

1:00 p.m. CT update: $20,650 raised from 214 donors (41% of goal). Keep the momentum going!

With urgency and gratitude,
Dr. Lila Nguyen
Program Director, Sunflower Community Health Alliance

P.S. Every dollar through midnight CT is doubled (up to $25,000). Give now: give.sunfloweralliance.org/GT

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professional GivingTuesday email that hits all major requirements with appropriate urgency and clear calls-to-action. The structure is scannable and action-oriented. Minor weaknesses include slightly mechanical social share language and dense formatting that could overwhelm mobile readers.
strengths: Excellent opening that connects global GivingTuesday movement to local mission immediately
Clear, specific impact metrics throughout (600 patients, 12 clinic days, 6 counties) that make the goal tangible
Strong tiered giving options with concrete outcomes at each level
Effective use of matching gift urgency and progress update to drive action
Multiple CTAs properly integrated (donate, share, volunteer) without feeling cluttered
Subject line is punchy and includes key motivators (urgency, match, geographic relevance)
Stays within 200-300 word target while remaining comprehensive
weaknesses: Social share language feels template-like ('I gave to [org]... Join me') rather than conversational—could be more authentic
The middle section with donation amounts and all the CTAs/links is visually dense and could benefit from more white space or formatting breaks
The phrase 'engage 500 donors' is insider jargon—'reach 500 donors' or '500 gifts' would be clearer
Multiple URLs listed in paragraph form may not render well in all email clients; bullet formatting would be safer

outputs.content:
**Subject: GIVE HOPE THIS GIVINGTUESDAY: Your Gift DOUBLES to End Homelessness!**

Dear Friend,

Today is GivingTuesday, a global day of radical generosity. It's a day when millions unite to make a profound difference, and TODAY, your kindness has the power to shatter the cycle of homelessness for families right here in our community.

At CityShelter Alliance, we believe every family deserves a safe, warm place to call home. This GivingTuesday, we have an ambitious, yet achievable, goal: **raise $600,000 from 2,500 donors in just 24 hours.** Why? Because 200 emergency winter beds are needed immediately, and 120 families are waiting for rapid-rehousing placements by January 31st – complete with vital move-in support and 3 months of stabilization services.

**Here's the incredible news:** The Morgan & Finch Foundation will **match every gift dollar-for-dollar up to $300,000 today!** Your donation's impact is instantly doubled!

**Here’s how your doubled gift transforms lives:**

*   **$50 ($100 matched!)** provides hot meals and winter supplies for a family for two days.
*   **$150 ($300 matched!)** covers a month of transit passes for job searches and appointments.
*   **$500 ($1,000 matched!)** funds a move-in kit (linens, cookware, cleaning supplies) for one family.
*   **$1,000 ($2,000 matched!)** bridges part of first-month rent so a family can sign a lease.
*   **$5,000 ($10,000 matched!)** supports a landlord partnership and intensive case management for one placement.

This isn't just about sheltering; it's about stability, dignity, and a future. Don't let this 24-hour window of incredible impact close!

**[YES! I want to double my impact and end homelessness now!]**

Please donate, then share this urgent message with your network using #CityShelterAlliance and #GivingTuesday. Every share, every donation, every volunteer hour brings us closer to a community where everyone has a home.

With immense gratitude and hope,

Alicia Ramos
Chief Development Officer
CityShelter Alliance

P.S. This GivingTuesday match ends at midnight! Help us reach our $600,000 goal and change lives today: [Direct Donation Link]

evaluation.reasoning: The email captures GivingTuesday energy and effectively communicates the matching gift opportunity with clear impact metrics. However, it significantly exceeds the 200-300 word limit (approximately 340 words), omits several required elements, and contains some tone inconsistencies that undermine the requested 'hopeful' approach.
strengths: Strong subject line that immediately highlights the matching gift opportunity
Clear, specific impact ladder with matched amounts effectively displayed
Good use of formatting (bold, bullets) to make content scannable
Effective opening that connects to the global GivingTuesday movement
Compelling P.S. with urgency and clear call-to-action
Professional signature block appropriate for the signer's role
weaknesses: Exceeds word count requirement by 40+ words (340 vs. 200-300 requested)
Missing the 4:00 PM progress update that was provided in the scenario data
Does not include specific volunteer call-to-action (only mentions 'volunteer hour' in passing)
Missing social media share language/copy - only includes hashtags without shareable text
Tone occasionally veers toward 'urgent/excited' rather than consistently 'hopeful' (phrases like 'shatter the cycle' and 'radical generosity' feel more aggressive than hopeful)
The donate button placeholder lacks specificity about where it should link
Does not provide easy-to-copy social share language as requested

outputs.content:
**Subject: [LIVE NOW] Double Your Impact for Families This GivingTuesday ⏰**

Today, millions of people across the globe are giving back. Right here in our city, **you can help 200 families find safety tonight and 120 families move into homes by January 31.**

**Our GivingTuesday Goal: $600,000 from 2,500 donors in 24 hours**

The Morgan & Finch Foundation is **MATCHING every dollar up to $300,000**—but only until midnight tonight.

**Here's what your gift accomplishes RIGHT NOW:**

💙 **$50** = Hot meals & winter supplies for a family (2 days)  
💙 **$150** = Month of transit passes for job searches  
💙 **$500** = Complete move-in kit for one family  
💙 **$1,000** = First-month rent bridge so a family signs their lease  
💙 **$5,000** = Full placement with case management & landlord partnership

Your donation today opens **200 emergency winter beds immediately** and funds **120 rapid-rehousing placements**—including rental assistance, employment support, and stabilization services to ensure families stay housed.

**[DONATE NOW - YOUR GIFT DOUBLES →]**

**Multiply your impact:** Share why you gave on social media using **#GivingTuesday #HomeForEveryFamily** and tag @CityShelterAlliance

**Can't give today?** Sign up to volunteer at **[volunteer link]**

Together, we're part of something bigger—a global day of generosity creating local miracles.

With hope and gratitude,

**Alicia Ramos**  
Chief Development Officer  
CityShelter Alliance

**P.S.** Midnight deadline! Your gift **DOUBLES** today only → **[DONATE LINK]**

---

**[4 PM UPDATE VERSION - Insert after "GivingTuesday Goal" paragraph:]**

**🎉 UPDATE 4:00 PM: 1,420 donors | $338,500 raised | 56% to goal!** We're SO CLOSE—help us finish strong!

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professional GivingTuesday email that successfully balances urgency with hopefulness. It hits all required elements, uses effective formatting for scannability, and creates compelling urgency without being overwhelming. The specific impact amounts are clear and actionable, and the matching gift is prominently featured.
strengths: Excellent subject line with urgency indicator and benefit-focused language
Perfect length at approximately 240 words, highly scannable with emoji bullets and bold text
Strong opening that connects global GivingTuesday movement to local impact immediately
Clear, specific impact ladder with five giving levels that are realistic and tangible
Effective use of matching gift throughout (subject, body, P.S.) creating urgency
Multiple CTAs included (donate, share with hashtags, volunteer) as requested
Smart inclusion of both base version and 4PM update version showing flexibility
Hopeful tone maintained while still creating urgency through deadline and match
Social media integration is specific and actionable with hashtags and handle
P.S. is punchy and reinforces the two key urgency elements (deadline + match)
weaknesses: The phrase 'local miracles' in closing may feel slightly generic or overly sentimental for some organizational cultures
Could benefit from one brief testimonial or story element to add emotional connection beyond statistics
The 4PM update placement instruction is clear but could specify whether to replace or add to existing content

outputs.content:
Subject: It’s GivingTuesday—double your impact to move families home today

Friend,

Today the world turns compassion into action. On GivingTuesday, your gift fuels a global movement—and powers our local mission to prevent homelessness and move families from shelters into safe, stable housing with rental assistance, case management, and employment support.

In the next 24 hours, CityShelter Alliance must raise $600,000 from 2,500 donors. The Morgan & Finch Foundation will match every gift dollar-for-dollar up to $300,000 today.

What your GivingTuesday gift will make possible:
- Open 200 emergency winter beds immediately
- Fund 120 rapid-rehousing placements by January 31—including move-in support and 3 months of stabilization services

Your impact today:
- $50 provides hot meals and winter supplies for a family for two days
- $150 covers a month of transit passes for job searches and appointments
- $500 funds a move-in kit (linens, cookware, cleaning supplies) for one family
- $1,000 bridges part of first-month rent so a family can sign a lease
- $5,000 supports a landlord partnership and intensive case management for one placement

Give now: citieshelteralliance.org/give
Share: “I gave to @CityShelterAlliance for #GivingTuesday to move families from shelter to home. Join me: citieshelteralliance.org/give”
Volunteer: citieshelteralliance.org/volunteer

4:00 p.m. ET update: 1,420 donors and $338,500 raised (56% to goal).

Together, we can make sure every family has a warm bed tonight—and a front door to call their own.

With hope and gratitude,
Alicia Ramos
Chief Development Officer, CityShelter Alliance

P.S. Deadline is midnight. Every dollar is doubled today. Give now: citieshelteralliance.org/give

evaluation.reasoning: This is a strong, professional GivingTuesday email that hits all required elements with appropriate urgency and hope. The structure is scannable and action-oriented. Minor weaknesses include slightly generic opening language and the progress update placement feeling somewhat awkward mid-email rather than as a true update.
strengths: Excellent subject line that immediately communicates the matching gift opportunity
Clear, scannable structure with well-organized impact tiers and multiple CTAs
Strong specificity in goals and outcomes (200 beds, 120 placements by January 31)
Effective use of the matching gift as both urgency driver and value multiplier
Good balance of global GivingTuesday movement with local mission focus
Appropriate hopeful tone without being saccharine or manipulative
Social media share language is ready-to-use and includes handle and hashtag
Word count (approximately 250 words) fits the 200-300 word target perfectly
weaknesses: Opening line 'Today the world turns compassion into action' feels somewhat generic and AI-like
Progress update at 4pm appears mid-email without context—would work better as a separate afternoon send or clearly labeled as an update version
The greeting 'Friend,' may feel impersonal for an established org with a diverse donor base; personalization merge tag would be better
Minor redundancy: 'give now' appears three times in quick succession (CTA, P.S., and share section)
